Maupiti is situated at the extreme west of the

. It is a small island with a surface of about 9 square km and about 1.200 inhabitants. It was discovered in 1722 by the Dutch explorer Jacob Roggeveen. The island was hit by a heavy cyclone in 1997.

Maupiti's main attractions are the 5 motu (small islets):
Air Tahiti offers flights to Maupiti from

value: : Mon, Tue, Wed, Fri, Sun (flight time 55min)

The airport is on Motu Tuanai. The boat transfer by private taxi-boats to the main city takes 15min.
from Bora Bora to Maupiti on Tue, Thu and Sat.
leaves Vaitape on Bora Bora at 8.30am and arrives at Maupiti at 10.15am, leaving Maupiti again at 4pm and arriving at Bora Bora at 5.45pm. One way fare is CFP 3000, return CFP 4000 (2009).
Maupiti has 30 archaeological sites whiche are clearly signposted. The temples (marae) of the gods covered the four corners of the island.

value: content=about 1 km north of the main village, then turn left
climb MountTeerefaatiu with exceptional views of Bora Bora and Raiatea (and Tahaa on clear days as well).
